info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 8 at 6:39AM EDT until September 8 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following county, Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 745 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 639 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Lake Worth, Palm Beach, Greenacres, Palm Springs, Cloud Lake, Palm Beach International Airport, Gun Club Estates, Royal Palm Estates, Lake Clarke Shores, Glen Ridge and Lake Worth Corridor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT THIS MORNING
